title: [INTEGRATION] Prepare the 2.1.0 release
message: [INTEGRATION] Prepare the 2.1.0 release

title: [DEV] Removed privacy policy
message:
[DEV] Removed privacy policy

Since the ARSDK now explicitely specifies a min sdk version for
the libMux, READ_PHONE_STATE is not needed anymore.

title: [DEBUG] Trigger the sending loop in the onResume
message: [DEBUG] Trigger the sending loop in the onResume

title: [DEBUG] Fixed UI problem
message:
[DEBUG] Fixed UI problem

Fixed connection screen and connected screen displayed
at the same time.

Now, in the onResume, we check if we have drone. If we
don't, display the connection screen.

title: [DEVMINOR] Fixed warnings due to libs update
message: [DEVMINOR] Fixed warnings due to libs update

title: [DEV] Updated libs & gradle versions
message: [DEV] Updated libs & gradle versions

title: [DEV] Added a privacy policy
message:
[DEV] Added a privacy policy

This is required by Google Play since the app needs
the READ_PHONE_STATE permission.

title: [DEV] Prepare the 2.0.0 release
message: [DEV] Prepare the 2.0.0 release

title: [DEBUG] Fixed crash at app startup
message: [DEBUG] Fixed crash at app startup

title: [DEV] Allow to install on Android Wear 2.0 watches
message:
[DEV] Allow to install on Android Wear 2.0 watches

Also updated external libs/tools versions
Updated gradle version to 2.2.3
Updated target sdk version to 25
Updated Play Services version to 10.0.1
Updated ARSDK version to 3.11.0

Since target sdk version has been bumped to 25,
handle runtime permissions.

For Android Wear 2.0, create a standalone apk (but
force the handheld app to be installed).

To test the changes, I've created an alpha version
with version code 7 (and 8 for the Wear 2.0 version).

title: [DEV] Compatibility with MiniDrones
message:
[DEV] Compatibility with MiniDrones

Use of the 3.8.1 SDK which enables the connection to
the BLE products in libARController

Compatibility added for products:
RollingSpider
Airborne Cargo
Airborne Night

title: [DEV] Display a message if drone is on a 2.4ghz wifi band
message:
[DEV] Display a message if drone is on a 2.4ghz wifi band

Disconnections might appears more often on that band

Also disable by default the piloting with the watch
and wait for a user action to start it.
It is safer.

title: [DEBUG] Remove the data action when received
message:
[DEBUG] Remove the data action when received

Calling putDataMapRequest
with the same data doesn't fire onDataChanged
So I delete the action data when it has been received

title: [DEV] Lowered memory allocation on wear
message: [DEV] Lowered memory allocation on wear

title: [DEBUG] Communicate through DataApi
message:
[DEBUG] Communicate through DataApi

Communication between watch and handheld is done with
the DataAPI instead of the MessageAPI.

The MessageAPI seems to mess up with the Wifi connectivity.
Which produces constant disconnections between handheld and
Parrot product.
